page.title: 10HAWKHILL FARM.
page.content: {Hawkhill was built about 1085}possibly by{William I's standard bearer, {Gislebert de Tesson.}Mr.Vickers is the Duke's present tenant & isn't allowed to buy the farm which is mainly arable but he also breeds animals.He has 230 ewes,30 cows and 60 calves.Mr Vickers grows linseed,barley,peas,oil seed rape,potatoes,turnips and oats.For the arable farming Mr Vickers has 5 tractors,1 round bailer and 1 combine harvester.Mr. Vickers{specialises}in {turkey farming.}His mother started it all off so he took over.{He kills {2-3000 turkeys in one year.}Most of them are killed at{Christmas.}It's not very hard to keep turkeys because they are kept in one room.There has only been one disaster which was in 1973 when a hay shed burnt down.If Mr Vickers was not a farmer he would have been an engineer.
